title: Which British universities are best for a law degree? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in the United Kingdom

response.answer_text: There are a couple of factors here; what type of degree and who you want to work for. Many of the older firms and chambers still have a preference for an Oxbridge bachelors degree. This is slowly coming round but certain specialties such as intellectual property are focused to a few elite universities. If you are studying a postgraduate diploma in law (GDL) then most places will be good as long as you can fit the study hours around work. For an LLM, pick a university that caters to your interest. An LLM tends to be specialised so universities will have different subjects. A good example is maritime law or technology law. In most instances as long as the uni offers a qualifying law degree then it doesn't matter to the majority of recruiters.

Oxford, Cambridge, LSE, UCL and King's come out in the top twenty according to the QS rankings by subject: www.topuniversities.com law rank That chimes with my subjective opinion. I am sure Durham, Edinburgh, and Bristol would appear in many lists as well.
